alert.note: Alert for Florence; Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 11:35AM CDT until April 19 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near McAllister affecting Menominee and Marinette Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Iron, Florence and Dickinson Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near Niagara affecting Menominee, Florence, Marinette and Dickinson Counties. For the Menominee River...including Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, McAllister...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Niagara. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, In the city of Niagara, water begins to cover the Niagara boat landing on Tyler Road...and water approaches homes along Sherman Street. This stage compares to a flow of 16500 cubic feet per second. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Thursday evening to a crest of 14.5 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early next Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
